content.en: Efficient image retrieval: Researchers are exploring various algorithms to improve image retrieval systems. These algorithms aim to generate efficient binary codes that can enhance the performance of large-scale image databases. Some of the methods being investigated include active hashing, query-adaptive hashing, supervised hashing using graph cuts and boosted decision trees, unsupervised discriminative hashing, kernelized sparse hashing, and many more. These algorithms are designed to reduce storage and computation costs, improve nearest neighbor search, enhance semantic information, and achieve effective binary codes for image retrieval.
content.da: Effektiv billedgenfinding: Forskere undersøger forskellige algoritmer for at forbedre billedgenfindingssystemer. Disse algoritmer har til formål at generere effektive binære koder, som kan forbedre ydeevnen af storskala billeddatabaser. Nogle af de metoder, der undersøges, inkluderer aktiv hashing, forespørgsels-tilpasset hashing, overvåget hashing ved hjælp af grafskæringer og boosted beslutningstræer, uovervåget diskriminerende hashing, kerneliseret sparsom hashing og mange flere. Disse algoritmer er designet til at reducere lager- og beregningsomkostninger, forbedre nærmeste nabo-søgning, forbedre semantisk information og opnå effektive binære koder til billedgenfinding.
